name: Kepler-224
scenarioDescription:
The Kepler-224 Exoplanetary System

Kepler-224 is a star with 0.58 times the mass of the Sun, and 0.68 times its radius. It is located 2608.43 light years away from the solar system.

Kepler-224 is known to have 4 exoplanets in orbit around it.

Kepler-224 b

Kepler-224 b was discovered by the Kepler observatory using the transit method. Its discovery was announced in 2014-03. Its semi-major axis is 0.04 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. It takes 3.13 Earth days to complete an orbit around its host star, Kepler-224.

The mass of Kepler-224 b is 2.12 times the mass of Earth. The radius of Kepler-224 b is 1.39 that of Earth. At 2.12 Earth masses, Kepler-224 b is a so called Super Earth. Super Earths could be terrestrial worlds like Earth, but they could also be ocean worlds or terrestrial worlds wrapped in a substantial atmosphere, in which case some refer to them as Mini Neptunes. No Super Earths are known to exist in our solar system, but if it exists, the so-called Planet Nine could very well be a super Earth, as it is hypothesized to have a mass between five and ten Earth masses.

Kepler-224 c

Kepler-224 c was discovered by the Kepler observatory using the transit method. Its discovery was announced in 2014-03. Its semi-major axis is 0.06 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. It takes 5.93 Earth days to complete an orbit around its host star, Kepler-224.

The mass of Kepler-224 c is 14.72 times the mass of Earth. The radius of Kepler-224 c is 3.12 that of Earth. At more than 10 Earth masses, Kepler-224 c is an ice giant, a planet that is made up mostly of volatiles like water, amonia and methane, and enveloped by a dense hydrogen and helium atmosphere, much like Uranus and Neptune in our solar system.

Kepler-224 d

Kepler-224 d was discovered by the Kepler observatory using the transit method. Its discovery was announced in 2014-03. Its semi-major axis is 0.09 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. It takes 11.35 Earth days to complete an orbit around its host star, Kepler-224.

The mass of Kepler-224 d is 7.09 times the mass of Earth. The radius of Kepler-224 d is 2.3 that of Earth. At 7.09 Earth masses, Kepler-224 d is a so called Super Earth. Super Earths could be terrestrial worlds like Earth, but they could also be ocean worlds or terrestrial worlds wrapped in a substantial atmosphere, in which case some refer to them as Mini Neptunes. No Super Earths are known to exist in our solar system, but if it exists, the so-called Planet Nine could very well be a super Earth, as it is hypothesized to have a mass between five and ten Earth masses.

Kepler-224 e

Kepler-224 e was discovered by the Kepler observatory using the transit method. Its discovery was announced in 2014-03. Its semi-major axis is 0.12 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. It takes 18.64 Earth days to complete an orbit around its host star, Kepler-224.

The mass of Kepler-224 e is 4.91 times the mass of Earth. The radius of Kepler-224 e is 1.97 that of Earth. At 4.91 Earth masses, Kepler-224 e is a so called Super Earth. Super Earths could be terrestrial worlds like Earth, but they could also be ocean worlds or terrestrial worlds wrapped in a substantial atmosphere, in which case some refer to them as Mini Neptunes. No Super Earths are known to exist in our solar system, but if it exists, the so-called Planet Nine could very well be a super Earth, as it is hypothesized to have a mass between five and ten Earth masses.
description: 3D visualisation and gravity simulation of the exoplanet system Kepler-224, which contains 4 planets and was discovered by Kepler.
